org.mundo.xml
Class XMLFormatter

java.lang.Object
  java.io.Writer
      java.io.FilterWriter
          org.mundo.xml.XMLFormatter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.Appendable
public class XMLFormatter
extends java.io.FilterWriter

Formats an XML document by adding line breaks and indentations. There are two different ways to use this class:

  • Create an instance of XMLFormatter and use it as a FilterWriter. Example:
         XMLFormatter fmt=new XMLFormatter(new FileWriter("out.xml"));
     fmt.write(...);
  • Call the static method format to format a string.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler
